item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, September 18, 2024 at 11:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Why wordfreq will not be updated (1238 points | 372 comments)
2. Is Tor still safe to use? (294 points | 215 comments)
3. Comic Mono (84 points | 23 comments)
4. Moshi: A speech-text foundation model for real time dialogue (167 points | 25 comments)
5. 0day Contest for End-of-Life Devices Announced (191 points | 96 comments)
6. Ruby-SAML pwned by XML signature wrapping attacks (13 points | 2 comments)
7. Llama 3.1 Omni Model (111 points | 10 comments)
8. Bento: Jupyter Notebooks at Meta (147 points | 67 comments)
9. Qwen2.5: A Party of Foundation Models (106 points | 22 comments)
10. Meticulous (YC S21) is hiring to eliminate UI tests ( | hide)
11. Cloudflare misidentifies Hetzner IPs as being located in Iran (115 points | 62 comments)
12. A high-performance, zero-overhead, extensible Python compiler using LLVM (135 points | 45 comments)
13. LinkedIn is now using everyone's content to train their AI tool (126 points | 63 comments)
14. Show HN: I made crowdwave – imagine Twitter/Reddit but every post is a voicemail (71 points | 36 comments)
15. OpenTelemetry and vendor neutrality: how to build an observability strategy (39 points | 9 comments)
16. Interning in Go (17 points | 1 comment)
17. From Myth to Measurement: Rethinking US News and World Report College Rankings (4 points | discuss)
18. Launch HN: Cerebrium (YC W22) – Serverless Infrastructure Platform for ML/AI (35 points | 21 comments)
19. A overview of binaries, ELF, and NoMMU on Linux (43 points | discuss)
20. Gentle Guide to Self-Hosting (228 points | 97 comments)
21. Text makeup – a tool to decode and explore Unicode strings (21 points | discuss)
22. Microplastics in the olfactory bulb of the human brain (108 points | 101 comments)
23. Apple mobile processors are now made in America by TSMC (1438 points | 711 comments)
24. The Dune Shell (150 points | 47 comments)
25. RabbitMQ 4.0 Released (188 points | 71 comments)
26. Meta AI: "The Future of AI Is Open Source and Decentralized" (156 points | 74 comments)
27. Senate Vote Tomorrow Could Give Helping Hand to Patent Trolls (147 points | 29 comments)
28. Knowledge graphs using Ollama and Embeddings to answer and visualizing queries (75 points | 7 comments)
29. OpenAI Threatening to Ban Users for Asking Strawberry About Its Reasoning (219 points | 175 comments)
30. IBM is quietly axing jobs, source says (65 points | 47 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, September 18, 2024 at 11:15 PM UTC
